website_summaries.verdict: A far clearer sound and sharper image than you may expect for this inexpensive webcam.
pros: Clear 1080p video streaming and automatic low-light adjustment
Compatible with a wide range of platforms
cons: There is a slight “fisheye” effect around the edges of the webcam’s video

customer_reviews.title: No reply from seller!
customer_reviews.text: A little bit disappointed in the quality of this webcam. I thought the reviews suggested otherwise. Let's break it down, First the microphones, yes twin mics, are excellent. No issue at all 2, the picture says 1080p, more like 720, and that's at a push. 3, colours are blown all over the place with a high tiny of red/pink and i can't find any way to control it. Now, please note, I have only received this item today and will endeavour to find a solution at which point I will update this review but offhand, these are the facts. With everybodwanting webcams due to the madness out there I think we need to cautious what we pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality, Flimsy/Wobbly screen attachment
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, not sure what other people had been using before this, but i had an old 720p cheap webcam that was better picture quality. After researching more its only got a 2MP sensor, NO WONDER! for £40 its ridiculous. Hard to find webcams at the moment, sure but id wait and save the money for ANYTHING else. Rather wait and get a C920 which has a 15MP sensor, twice the price yes but 7.5x better quality! Also, the 'attachment' for sitting above your screen is terrible and doesnt actually work.. My hunt for a cheap interim webcam continues. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: PAH

customer_reviews.title: A poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: Everything poor quality. Instructions worthy of joke found inside Christmas cracker. Cheap carboard box with made in China on the side and not even the makers name. Picture was inferior to the original camera in my laptop. Horizontal lines and totally bleached out image with ghosting then after 3 minutes I become a silhouette. Microphone is also weak.
customer_reviews.author: Petrol

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I know that there is a shortage of Webcams out there at the moment, which pushes prices up, but I was really disappointed with the quality of this product. It was higher priced that many other standard webcams, and had very good reviews, but the image quality was terrible - far worse than the in-built webcam on my PC that I bought it to replace. It is going straight back.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Image quality not great, returning
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit put off as soon as I saw the basic grey cardboard box this came in with zero padding to protect the device. The camera is entirely unbranded, and comes with a single page instruction manual slightly smaller than a playing card. The picture quality is also off; a lot of contrast, and generally lower image quality than my laptop. It's definitely 1080p, but the image is just sort of odd. Don't get me wrong - could be that I got a duff camera, but this one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: Did not work returned Window 10 machine Might work on yours!
customer_reviews.author: John Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish focus
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for a word record attempt this Saturday as the specs and write up were favourable. Once plugged in, it was awful. I had to hold the camera about 1cm away to see something on focus. I appreciate that it’s probably one faulty device out of dozens that will be fine, but it’s a review based on what has been sent. I tried it on 3 different PC’s and the same problem was there. Once this weekend is out of the way I will be sending back ASAP and demanding my money back. I don’t want a replacement either :-/
customer_reviews.author: Jake Amos

customer_reviews.title: Distinctly average
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why this product has such glowing reviews. I can only imagine those posting positive reviews must have bought the camera more cheaply than I did. At £50, it's very disappointing. The picture quality is, at best, barely acceptable. It's noisy has poor white balance and is inclined to overexposing. If I'd paid around £20 I would have been satisfied. At £50 I expected more. I'd recommend you look for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gillett

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the high reviews on this product - they are not credible
customer_reviews.text: This very clearly not a HD webcam in being at a very blunt resolution. The colours are all off also, with skin being made to appear as a lurid pinkish. The microphone is next to useless as well - you have to lean right into the webcam for it to pick up you voice at any normal level of volume. It simply isn't credible that others can have reviewed this product and give it 5 stars, so I'm inclined to believe that those reviews aren't honest. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Image only ok but with blown out highlights - disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The image produced by the camera was very poor in that all the colours were wrong and highlights were blown out - feels very plasticy. Really disappointed given all the positive reviews - could not recommend. My laptop camera is far better. UPDATE - increased the rating to 3 stars because they did try very hard to resolve my problems. Supplied a replacement, which was better but still not great. Offering me payment to delete my review seemed a little off though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful customer service
customer_reviews.text: After an initial hiccup the team followed up and resolved everything- helpful customer service. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Erin Atherton

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality all round
customer_reviews.text: I paid £39.99 and was surprised at the poor quality even for that price. It's a fish-eye lens so the perspective for a webcam is not good. Everything is curved. It stretches your face which is not what most people want. It was plug and play, so well done on that. But the picture did not look 1080p. I returned the item as I was looking to get better pictures than my old built in webcam, but this was not better in any way. It does not clip to the screen it only balances. I think they are capitalising on the lack of webcams and this would have been under £5 before lock down. I definitely feel cheated.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: wansview 1080P
customer_reviews.text: Let's start with the good points: -plug & Play -Autofocus -1080 pixels -easy to install/set up Bad points: -the red LED is too bright, annoying after a while -there is NO software with it which could be good but there is no way to control some settings like flipping left-right. When using win 10 camera, the left/right is correct. However when using Skype or Zoom, the left/right is inverted. Very annoying when you have to show a sketch or any paper. I'm asking the vendor for help here and if no solution I'll send it back
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Webcam
customer_reviews.text: I had previously been using a 720p Webcam. This is a definite step up in terms of picture quality. I have used the camera with Microsoft Teams and Zoom without any issue. No driver installation was required. The only (very minor) criticism is something I have seen other reviewers mention - the red indicator LED is far too bright. A dimmer version or an alternative colour (blue or green) may have been better. Overall though, this is a very impressive device
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sandham

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality from wansview
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is poor and sound awful. Was extremely embarrassed on a business video call as no one could make out what I was saying. As others have written it seems to have a wide angle lens fitted which I expect is from their CCTV camera range and not what you want for a webcam. Disappointed as I have wansview CCTV cameras and they are great. The issues maybe driver related? But sent it back and went back to my 10 year or more old webcam which is superior to this!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising?
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived on time as was advertised and promised. Under the current World conditions that has to be commended, however I'm not convinced it is a genuine article or current model. It came in a very plain unmarked box. Nothing to indicate its source; no serial numbers, product ID or markings and no tripod screw insert on its base as indicated in the advertising photo. On the positive side, I have tested the specs and they are correct. The item is PnP, 2Mpx sensor, FHD at around 30fps. It works well, but time will tell if it was value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph, Co. Antrim

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced HD Webcam, works a treat, quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this after cancelling an order for a Logitech 920s that had been on order since March and hadn't been delivered (just not available). I needed a webcam for my Mac mini, this was less than half the price of the Logitech and works a treat. Simple to install, clips nicely on my monitor, is small and relatively unobtrusive, gives a good enough picture and works with Zoom. Just what I needed. Can't comment on the sound as I use the external speakers attached to the Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E

customer_reviews.title: Poor picture, terrible audio. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after seeing so many positive reviews. However, I really should have paid attention to the poor reviews. Have done a few video calls and friends who have said my audio had tonnes of ‘whooossshhh’ noise distracting them, and at times even interfering with my voice. The picture quality is pretty poor too, the colours are incorrect making skin over pink and extremely over sharpened. Adjusting the focus wheel does nothing to resolve this. Have started a return and am buying the Logitech StreamCam instead. It’s just over 4 times the price on eBay currently, but just super fed up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hopeless! Not HD
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked at how poor the picture quality was. Blobby, massively red-saturated image. A poorer quality than web-cams of 15 years back. No way I’d this HD. Atrocious. Also- it wouldn’t grip to my laptop and just flipping wobbled. Hopeless. (Which raises the question why there are so many very positive reviews?)
customer_reviews.author: Zoony Lazoon

customer_reviews.title: OK If you don't mind looking like a tomato
customer_reviews.text: Your face will be weirdly glossy, pixelated, super shiny skin with a very unappealing reddish hue. There are no drivers or software that will fix this, it is just a very poor quality lens. This is apparently HD, I have an old Microsoft lifecam which is HD and there is literally no comparison. I wanted another one for work but this was seriously embarrasing. Sending back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Bass Man

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality and works really well
customer_reviews.text: This product really works well. Plug and play. The resolution is 1920x1080, producing pretty crisp images and video capture, there is not too much lag if you are just sitting down talking in a conference call or streaming. 30 frames per second is decent. If you start moving around too quickly, then it will be a bit choppy and laggy. I would say for its price, this product is amazing. The quality of the product is very well made, the weight distribution is perfect so it will sit on top of a monitor or laptop just fine. I would recommend this product as it comes up as one of the best webcams on the market around this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Lau

customer_reviews.title: Decent picture but I to phone useless and blocks monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great on image, though it struggles with varying light a bit, but pretty useless for sound. With this mounted on top of my monitor and me sitting at my desk I have to use Bluetooth headphones as a microphone. Using Zoom and Microsoft Teams colleagues were unable to hear me clearly, to the extent they couldn’t work out what I was saying, when I used the integrated microphone. Might have expected that at the current price of £39.99, but just a week and a half ago I paid £49.99 so it’s pretty disappointing. Also blocks the screen on my monitor, so I have to tilt it up when I’m not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Ailsabm

customer_reviews.title: Made me look very sunburnt!
customer_reviews.text: Received the item super quickly as always from Amazon. Installing it was as simple as plugging it in and worked great. The microphone quality was clear. So why the 1 star? The image quality - the colours made me look as though I was incredibly sunburnt. First time I used it, my family were all very worried I had been in the sun all day and got myself really sun burnt! The second time my work colleagues found it very funny though one messaged me after asking if I was ok health wise! So back to using my iPhone camera and thankfully Amazon now seems to have a super easy return policy so I can get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Ruddick

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact & decent quality
customer_reviews.text: With so many to choose from & having no tech knowledge, I wasn't sure what to expect. However, I am very pleased. It was easy to set up on the laptop and adjusting settings is straightforward. Working from home & engaging in regular Zoom/Team meetings, it has performed extremely well. The clip enables it to be angled well, although I am now considering a tripod stand to raise the overall height of the camera & not sure the attachment/fixing will be easy. Overall the sound & picture quality has been good, in fact better than other peoples I've been 'on screen' with!
customer_reviews.author: J. H. Norrey

customer_reviews.title: Webcam stopped working after 2 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Plugged into USB port on laptop, camera started working straight away as advertised with fantastic picture quality and then 2 minutes later stopped working. The picture froze and then disappeared. Tried plugging into other USB ports but webcam wouldn't work. Didn't get the opportunity to try out the sound. Beware when buying as you may receive a faulty webcam.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent webcam
customer_reviews.text: Since most people are working remote these days, I purchased a webcam to make Zoom meetings easier and improve the video and sound quality during remote discussions with my colleagues. I've received positive feedback from everyone on video quality during meetings, even in difficult lighting situations like bright sun or less light in the late afternoon. Similarly, the microphone seems to work well, loud and clear over the past few days of usage. Overall recommended to anyone needing a reliable way of visual and audio communication when working from home!
customer_reviews.author: Iulia

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality a complete waste of the planets resources
customer_reviews.text: This is not fit for purpose. The video quality is very bad, over exposed and a massive lag in the video, completely unusable as a video webcam for conferencing. The build quality is also poor, nasty plastic, cheap mount and the on LED is far too bright. It's such a shame that such bad products are made and shipped around the world. Returning whilst something better is found
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Works well on Linux
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a webcam at a sensible price since the Covid lock downs started. This one was a reasonable price with OK reviews. It worked straight out of the box on Linux Mint 20 with both Skype and Zoom. Picture is sharp and clear with good colour. There is a Fish eye effect around the perimeter of the image but that really doesn't matter as the objective of the camera is to show what's in the middle. I use the built in microphone on the camera for input but use the existing speakers on my system for output. It works well for me so happy to recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stelea

customer_reviews.title: Great High Resolution Camera
customer_reviews.text: I used many camera, mainly for teleconferencing and video chats. This one is by far the best own I have owned, very clear picture and the microphone is good as well. Its much better than my laptop's so i plan to use it with that as well. The camera can be attached on top of any screen pretty easily with the standard fittings so it wont fall off yet it can be easily removed. I have also many other cameras from the same brand and have the entire house with 12 ip cameras connected to their nvr, so far they all performed great. So im really confident about the brand and it didn't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: No possibility to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but this one is a must as it comes with a warning. In everything else, this webcam was fine but the contrast meant that everything had a pink tinge to it - with no opportunity to adjust it. Had to return it as it was not acceptable. Might have been just mine with a problem but the lack of opportunity to adjust is a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Storey

customer_reviews.title: Completely dead out of the box, and does not fit well on my monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Dead out of the box, saw the red light for a moment once. Not recognised on my PC or Mac. The mechanism for securing it on the monitor it not great, especially if you have older monitors that are slightly thicker, and don't have a dead straight back it will just fall off with the slightest movement of the cable. Fits really well, and can see how the mechanism is supposed to work, if I turn it to face backwards! I would be using bluetac on this if I had kept it. Honestly I would look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Really good webcam
customer_reviews.text: This is really good. I was relying on my iPad to do all the Teams and Zoom meetings during lockdown but it wasn’t really giving me the best experience. This camera fits well on top of my screen and was truly plug and play- no messing about at all. I’m informed that it gives a good picture and good sound quality too although it is a very wide angle so it shows most of my room not just the carefully arranged bookcase! Having said that, I would buy it again and I would buy other products from this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Dennett

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not brilliant...
customer_reviews.text: This webcam is OK, but not the best... Quality of the camera is pretty poor despite being advertised as 1080p HD... It is alright if you just want something simple for conference calls or video chats with friends & family, but don't be expecting high quality footage from it. I wouldn't advise paying £40 for this & would expect to buy this product around £20 from the quality you get, and would suggest going for another brand - the only reason I'm keeping this and not returning it is I cannot be bothered faffing around with postage during COVID19, and I do not intend on using it that often.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Am I blue or am I red?
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap HD camera. In fairness, the picture focus and quality is good but the camera decides whether to red-shift my image, or blue-shift it. Sometimes multiple times during the same call. A little weird. The microphone is good but very directional, so small movements lead to complaints that I can't be heard properly. But, most of all, it doesn't play nice with Teams. Sometimes it remains 'on' at the end of call which results in not being able to close a call, or worse not being able to enter the next call successfully. I'm going to bite the bullet and spend proper money on a better camera. Fingers crossed!!
customer_reviews.author: catkins

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Reading the reviews, I had high hopes for this webcam, but was really let down. The plus point is that it's plug and play, picked up by the computer straight away. However, the picture quality was very poor and laggy and in low light was even worse. I know the current times mean such devices now leave companies open to hike the prices up, but £50 for this cheaply made, poorly performing webcam is a disgrace. I don't know what it cost in January, but £20-£25 seems a fair price point to me. My solution, use my phone as a webcam.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. K. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! Rubbish picture quality.
customer_reviews.text: Over saturated colours, makes faces bright red and white, the grass outside looks like it's been painted with flouresant paint! Fish eye lens is rubbish. Sound clips on/off for no apparent reason. It's worse than the webcam I had twenty years ago! It's only 2 Megapixels and looks like an oversharpened 480 image, dreadful. Also looks more like 10 frames persecond, not 30. Going straight back!
customer_reviews.author: Laurieast

customer_reviews.title: Poor Webcam
customer_reviews.text: So like most people I read the reviews. There were some good and some bad, thought I’d take a gamble. Didn’t pay off! I’m not sure what all the positive reviews are about! Plugged it into my MacBook Air 2014 to test it with Zoom and the quality is terrible compared to the inbuilt camera. Didn’t even try the microphone as the Camera was so bad. Straight back in the box and returning to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: J Youell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for WFH video chat.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to finally be able to join in on the video chats with my work colleagues as we are all working from home. The camera works flawlessly for me. I just plugged it in. No drivers to load or settings to mess around with. For my use, I am on a Windows 7 PC using Microsoft TEAMS. The picture quality is more than acceptable and I would say certainly better than most built-in cameras on laptop PC's. Very good value for money and a worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Krog

customer_reviews.title: Camera is good but... not new!
customer_reviews.text: The camera arrived in a very small box. The cable was nicely coiled and fixed with a wire tie. I noticed a small green sticker on the front of the camera - it was not a protective cover though. Closer inspection showed some scratches on the camera front plate. Hmmm. Obviously not a new one! Maybe the green sticker denoted it was returned and tested as working? I decided to try it out before attempting to send it back. It does work ok - the scratch is only cosmetic. There is no autofocus so I am not sure why it was included in the questionnaire for this review.
customer_reviews.author: ptan

customer_reviews.title: Just awful
customer_reviews.text: As others have observed, the instructions are risible. The camera itself has no markings, no 'badging' to give you confidence that it's reasonable. The manual focus is just awful - the best image I could get of my face made me look like a tomato. My PC camera is far superior. Just an awful product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Burrows

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy, perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended. This is so plug and play it's ridiculous. On my Windows 10 PC, I just plugged it in to a spare USB port. It was immediately recognised, the driver installed and it just worked. I guess there might be a software package to further customise the installation, but I've not bothered. The picture quality is great and I was pleased (and surprised) to find out that not only does it have a built-in microphone, the sound quality is brilliant. Even the mount is starightforward, gripping my monitor without any trouble at all. From what I can tell, it will accomodate any width of monitor up to and including 37mm, possibly a tad more.
customer_reviews.author: rb14

customer_reviews.title: Really good quality image.  Doesn't seem to work for Windows facial recognition login though
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Teams and Zoom meetings instead of using my laptop. I just plugged it in to my Win 10 Pro PC and within a few seconds it was up and running. Picture quality is great - better than any of my phone or laptop cameras it seems. My only disappointment is that it does not seem to offer facial recognition for logging on, which would have been great. To be fair, I didn't buy it for this and so perhaps I should not be knocking a star off for not having a feature I didn't buy it for in the first place?!?!?
customer_reviews.author: Ed the Duck

customer_reviews.title: Impressive webcam
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this webcam to improve the videocall quality now that we are making more frequent use of these technologies during lockdown. The HD quality of the video was impressive, really well defined, vibrant colours and a more wider image than expected. The installation was very easy. Just connect the USB and you are good to go. The clip adjustment is simple but effective and you can adjust the angle of the camera easily with this system. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera, unsatisfactory mic
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera, no doubt about that. However the microphone is not all I'd hoped for. My ideal scenario is using pc speakers to hear and webcam to listen. However there is a constant echo loop. If I turn down the microphone levels to a point this stops I have to either shout or put my face right up to the camera to be heard. It picks up so much background noise at an optimal speaking level that on calls people can hear my neighbours kids playing or my wife emptying the dishwasher downstairs. I have to mute constantly as to not be annoying on calls, even using headphones to prevent the feedback loop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Webcam
customer_reviews.text: I have previously bought Wansview security cameras and have been very impressed with the image quality so I decided to go for a new Web Cam and again chose Wansview and again I am impressed with the image quality and sound. The camera comes in a simple brown box and is easy to install simply plug it in and switch the PC on. I am running Windows 10 and the camera worked straight away. The cable is about 1.5m long so easily reaches the PC from the top of the monitor
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: Better than you could ever expect
customer_reviews.text: For what it costs, I wasn't expecting much of it to be honest, but it blew my expectations out of the water! I had a Logitech C920 before this webcam, and honestly, I prefer this one, for the Zoom and focus, the clarity is damn near identical, and this one is clearer in darker environments too. I honestly didn't expect it to be so good but now I use it for game streaming, zoom meetings and discord calls, and I'll be buying another when I have the need
customer_reviews.author: Marshall F.

customer_reviews.title: Over exposed - no way of correcting.
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the worst tech I’ve bought online. I sit infront of a window and the camer over exposes to a degree that areas of my face are bright white. I’ve tried third party settings apps to correct it but the camera just crashes. Total rubbish!
customer_reviews.author: errumm

customer_reviews.title: sound unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I have to agree with another customer that 2 months into purchasing this product I have been badly let down by the poor quality of its sound in all the constant video calls I'm having. I have tried absolutely anything to adjust the volume and had IT uninstall it and re-install it but unsuccessfully. The sound is at best muffled and far away and it has forced me to now buy an external mic. the picture quality is OK apparently.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Wansview have done it again!!
customer_reviews.text: Only came across Wansview recently but so far I am very impressed. This webcam is just perfect for what I wanted with a great picture quality and sound quality. The price is just fantastic for sucha stunning product. I'm running Windows 10 and this camera was just out of the box, plug and play. The light on the front indicates when the camera is live which is a neat function for security. I couldn't have wanted more from a webcam. Thanks again Wansview.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as is the most sold item in the section. It is totally unusable, the sound on it is terrible. I have tried numerous things to resolve it and I have tried it on 2 laptops. It is simply unusable. Please don't waste your time or money
customer_reviews.author: Pete G.

customer_reviews.title: A good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing bad to say about this little camera, for the low price of like £22 it really is a perfect little webcam, admittedly I was original skeptical. I’d never heard of the brand before. But literally plugged it in and away you go, no mucking about with software or anything like that. Works great I have used it for Skype, House party and teams, great camera image and also has a good microphone which is always nice.
customer_reviews.author: Toby S.

customer_reviews.title: Good camera and mic with some minor annoyances
customer_reviews.text: I needed a webcam for my desktop PC to use for conference calls and it has been excellent for this. Good quality wide angle image and the built in microphone is good too. For me, the cable was too short and I needed to use a usb extension cable because my tower unit sits about 3 feet away from my monitor. The red led that indicates when the camera is active is useful but is far brighter than it needs to be and is annoyingly so in low light conditions. However I can forgive those issues for what is a very good webcam for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Haruhi

customer_reviews.title: Bad image quality, purple hue over pictures. No software and no settings
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately by far the worst web camera I've ever had and this is not even the cheapest one I've had. There are no settings you can use with OBS, there is no software and there is no autofocus. You can manually adjust the lens by manually rotate it, but everything also has a purple hue to it and the quality is absolutely terrible. The photo added is of me using the webcam on stock settings, trying to use OBS to even out the colors just makes it worse.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin kyo Nightwolf

customer_reviews.title: Wansview Webcam - Great for working from home
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for working from home as my old and tired webcam was just not up to the job. It arrived next day and it within minutes it was installed. - Great picture and audio quality - Plug and play - detected and installed automatically on my Windows 10 system - Also tested on my old PC running Windows 7 - also Plug and Play - Clever clip design - mounts easily on top of my monitor No negatives so far that I can find.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Camera is picking up all the room, a slight fish eye effect
customer_reviews.text: A nice camera, gives you a good definition and improves seen completion. It works good with the green screen. However, the camera gives image a bit of a fish eye effect, rounds up the surrounding of the room and sides of the green screen become visible, unless you put in really big green screen. If you want to work with the green screen, get another camera that gives flat image and does not pick up other areas. Remember that camera has adjustable focus, just turn the ring around it.
customer_reviews.author: Vera Horton

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible camera
customer_reviews.text: No idea where these good reviews are coming from. The true reviews seem to be buried amongst them. To be fair, this camera does produce a picture and the microphone works well. That is about it. The picture quality is terrible, it makes it look like you have a pink face, regardless of background colour or lighting. There is no software to adjust the colouring either. I don't like looking like I'm permanently sunburnt. I've only used the camera with the Microsoft photo app and Zoom. I would avoid at all costs, and buy a branded camera for about £10 more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Webcam for idiots!
customer_reviews.text: Webcam for idiots is what would have been helpful but there were no instructions with the camera. That said having spent 1 1/2 hours on the phone to an IT specialist we got the camera working. (It didn't help that my husband had fiddled with the lens before it was working! - see what I mean Webcam for idiots!) Great, love it and it does all it should and is used very regularly in view of our present situation.
customer_reviews.author: MagsN

customer_reviews.title: It gives me yellow teeth....
customer_reviews.text: This webcam has a really heavy filter on it that I couldn't figure out how to take off. It makes my teeth look sooo yellow! Not what I was after!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: Despite some of the rave reviews I was disappointed by this webcam. It was not significantly better than my old Teknet 720p. The image under bright daylight was completely overblown - I had to pull down the blinds to get an acceptable image. The wide angle was not that helpful - giving a bit of a fish-eye image - my old Teknet has 70ish degrees and that is better. Mic sound was slightly better. Not worth £49- returned.
customer_reviews.author: The Laughing Mole

customer_reviews.title: Crisp images, clear sound.  Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Really great little webcam this. My partner is a teacher and has recently been having to do a lot of zoom meetings during the current pandemic, this has greatly improved those meetings. Others in the meeting have actively commented on how my partners image was so crisp and the sound so clear! I think this is the best illustration of how good this camera is in use. A great improvement over a lot of built in webcams. Set up was also a doddle and everything worked first time. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Edinburgh Man

customer_reviews.title: Great little webcam at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Now that working from home is becoming part of the norm I needed a reliable webcam that I can depend upon for digital meetings. This webcam is absolutely ideal for a few reasons: - The video quality is good. The colour and sharpness are what you'd expect for the price. - The microphone is also OK. It picks up most things if you are sat directly in front of the camera. - Its plug and play. No hassle, it does what it says on the box! - Works perfectly with teams/zoom/skype... any comms applications. Overall, this webcam is a bargain. Don't go spending loads when you can get this little beauty.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Good budget price webcam
customer_reviews.text: A small, compact (8cmx4cm) solution for anyone without a built-in camera on their PC screen. Easy to set up, just plug in the USB cable (1m) to an appropriate port on your PC or laptop. You may need to adjust settings in any video conferencing software. I've tested the sound quality using the webcam with the in-built Camera app and with Zoom. All is clear. Picture quality is satisfactory although there doesn't seem to be any way of altering the colour balance.
customer_reviews.author: Foster Maclean

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable image quality, colour and contrast.
customer_reviews.text: Compact unit. Unfortunately, image quality is unacceptable. High contrast, poor colour, pixelated. Only adjustment possible is brightness in Windows 10. Camera on notebook computer is superior as is a 10-year old webcam that I was trying to replace. Only driver is Windows default. No additional software available. Being sent back for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Ian R White

customer_reviews.title: very low image quality, probably 540p
customer_reviews.text: very low quality resolution, it's nowhere near 1080p, probably closer to 540p. cheapish and plug in and go, but very low image resolution from what's advertised. the stand/clamp is also very limited, you can only fave the camera exactly forward from the screen and tip up or down, so may be an issue unless you are sat directly in front of the screen etc
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. Southam

customer_reviews.title: Amazon return service is brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work. Sent it back. Going to get one with a brand name. Plugged it in and no picture just sound. It was found by my laptop, drivers all up to date and apparently working. Troubleshooting - nothing. It just didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: viv5645

customer_reviews.title: Great webcam for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when i had to work from home and had to have Zoom and Teams meetings every day. The quality is great on this camera and no issues with the sound. I used it on my macbook pro that had a fault on the HD cam so this was dead easy to install. I really didn't want to spend £120 on a logitech so for this price it's a great webcam for me hence 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Marty James

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great product.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant budget webcam. I'm using mine for my streaming, but it would also work for video calls or other webcam related uses. The quality is really clear and its easy to set up. It's only downfall is the bright red light informing you that it's turned on, which is very useful, but very bright, I recommend sticking some tape over it to make it less blinding if you do purchase one.
customer_reviews.author: James Ratcliffe

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, unbranded cam
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in unbranded packaging - I've no idea what make it is. This is bad. It set itself up first time when connected. This is good. Its colour management is weird, makes everybody look tanned or red in the face. There is no way of changing this or any other of its settings. Not good. It works, which is the best that can be said of it but, given that it is an unbranded product with no controls or support, it's way overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Blueskyabove

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The camera is suitable enough for Zoom/Teams/Discord video calls so everyone is able to see you, however the video quality itself has its issues. It is definitely a higher resolution than standard, but it feels very processed with what I can only describe as boosted sharpening, colour and dithering artefacts all over. Your smartphone camera is very likely better than this. The microphone is not worth it, which is why I use an audio interface with an external microphone instead for meetings. If you need a decent microphone you might have to look elsewhere for an all-in-one webcam device or look for external USB/XLR ones and just use this for video.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Dorgan

customer_reviews.title: Camera quality is sub par but the microphone is unusable
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not 1080 resolution. Or it is but some other quality of the camera is poor, at any rate, it's cheap. I guess I was hoping as we had moved forward with tech webcams at this price point would be a bit better - but the image is passable. It's the microphone that's really bad. It's unusable, so I'm using my headset microphone. I think I'll be after a refund honestly.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Great for Skype and Zoom meetings
customer_reviews.text: I needed a webcam since we went into lockdown for zoom and Skype calls. I wanted something simple to set up, I own a couple of Wansview cameras which I have been impressed with so this was an obvious choice. The webcam arrived the next day and just requires you to plug the usb in. You can clip it on your tv or laptop. The quality and clarity of the picture was very good compared to that of my laptop camera. I found the inbuilt microphone reduces background sound which is useful. There are a few cheaper cameras but this is is definitely a good camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Seema P.

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed in this.
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed in this camera. I got it because its advertised as 1080p HD and needed it for virtual appointments on my computer. But the quality was really poor to the point it is unusable. Doesn't even catch my mouth move when talking and the picture quality was awfull. The sound was poor too. So unfortunately I cannot use it so I feel I need to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Britmatt81

customer_reviews.title: Smart looking and excellent resolution
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Wansview product. The first 2 were home security cameras and I needed this webcam for online eductaional use. I was attracted by the promise of very clear picture quality which is better than the lower quality one I had been using and works well in all light conditions. It looks smart and has a decent cable length, so I can use it in various locations. The instructions are very brief and packaging simple, but thankfully it just plugs in and works.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little camera
customer_reviews.text: Ever since not being able to see my family we have been having regular meetings on Zoom, the webcam on my laptop was broken so I’d been using my phone. After looking around at various webcams I decided to buy this one and I’m glad I did. The video and audio are clear, it’s easily clipped on to your laptop or TV! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Bad Quality. DO NOT BUY . You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I saw reviews with photos from other people showing the quality of this webcam. and I'm not sure if they are fake or I was sent a different product but whatever I got, and what you will most likely get is utter garbage. I do not recommend this for anyone atall. Just put in some good money and get a decent webcam. But my fault, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Orin

customer_reviews.title: Useless item - did not work
customer_reviews.text: This webcam is advertised as plug-in-and-play. I tried plugging-in two different USB ports on my Windows 10 desktop PC and absolutely nothing happened apart from a brief blink of the red light. Am returning the item as faulty.
customer_reviews.author: MAL at CFA

customer_reviews.title: 1080p camera
customer_reviews.text: In this price range this is very nice camera. Video quality is very good, fullHD vide stream, conference video call, video recording all works great. Audio quality is also good, clear. Tryed to use camera with raspberrypi wich also works great without any problems. Thinking to get another of this camera to use for multiple video recording of my projects I'm working on. will definitely recommend this camera for anyone who want to upgrade their old webcam or to get their first webcam.
customer_reviews.author: 3dinvisible

customer_reviews.title: No autofocus
customer_reviews.text: Camera is outstanding for its price bracket, its clear**, crisp and honestly works flawlessly with it being a standard USB peripheral. **When in focus. The Cons of this little camera is that it does NOT have Autofocus and instead you must turn the lense in order to adjust the focus. Honestly for most people who are sitting a equal distance from the camera this isnt going to be an issue though.
customer_reviews.author: May Family

customer_reviews.title: Camera great, mic average.
customer_reviews.text: The camera function seems to work fine on my Microsoft laptop and my Linux desktop, and is compatible with Zoom. However, the microphone function is less reliable. I sometimes get comments in video conferences that the sound is too quiet, or, when I turn up mic sensitivity in an app (e.g. Zoom), that the sound clips and crackles. So I am now considering a separate mic. But I won't ditch this camera, since it is mostly pretty good for me.
customer_reviews.author: Norbert Phlemshanks

customer_reviews.title: For the money, its fine.  Suspect it would have been cheaper pre Covid
customer_reviews.text: You plug it in, it works. Never going to win an award for picture quality but people say it looks fine and the microphone is very effective. Lens sticks out a long way so not the best to sling in a bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tech-nee-cull

customer_reviews.title: Awesome HD CAM
customer_reviews.text: This the forth Wansview camera that i have purchased and yet again i am very impressed. Great quality & outstanding HD Picture . Works very well on zoom etc. Also has a nice clip that sits on top of your laptop. Microphone is crystal clear. You can take photos and Video also rotate the footage. Focus is easy by a simple turn of the lens. Nice long USB cable too. For the price dont think you could buy better.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Great camera to support the new world of working from home with video conferences all the time
customer_reviews.text: With the increased number of video conferences for work the camera on my laptop was limiting as it cant be moved and the built in microphone was really poor. This camera solved that. Plug and play and tested with MS Teams, Skype, Zoom etc etc . I am told the pictrue is better than with the laptop and the sound much clearer. Great value for money
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality in all aspects
customer_reviews.text: Product lost colour and is now black and white after less than 6 weeks (no not a driver issue, tested on multiple different PC's). Manual focus only, no auto focus. Microphone quality is not an improvement over laptop mic's. Image quality is average at best, most phones beat it for quality, even old and cheap phones. Absolutely no support, no manual, and the return window is only 30 days, which is useless for me when it failed after 40 days.
customer_reviews.author: N. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Made faces look Red
customer_reviews.text: Saw this “red face” issue posted after purchase. Not sure why everyone doesn’t have same issue. If it helps, was used with a Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: The webcam was purchased for a friend so we could talk on video through Discord or Skype. The camera quality is brilliant especially for the price as others I've used haven't been as good. the mic built into the camera also functions well with a strong and clear sound. Connecting the device was really simple as it has a "plug and play" system through a USB. Definitely worth purchasing as it's made lockdown much more tolerable as it's allowed me to stay in contact with those closest to me.
customer_reviews.author: Spirexx

customer_reviews.title: Great webcam
customer_reviews.text: I decided it was about time my colleagues got to see my face again so as I have a wansview wifi camera I decided to buy myself this webcam, and I'm really happy with it! I use Linux so I was slightly concerned that it'd be a faff, but it wasn't, I just plugged it in and within a second I was looking back at myself on Zoom. The picture was really good quality, and there was no lag at all, i'd definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Prestwood

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: I like it, the picture is really clear.....I would say that it's very 'zoomed in'. Sitting at my normal distance from my monitor, I appear larger than life in the picture. To appear more 'normal' sized (i.e. not fill the screen), you have to sit a long way back. But the image is really good, and I've just blue-tac'd it to the top of my monitor where it sits happily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value webcam with manual focus
customer_reviews.text: This webcam does everything you need a webcam to do and it'll be another camera angle for my Twitch channel. Very handy having manual focus as auto focus cameras can mess around in low light conditions when there are disco lights flashing around the room. Only reason it lost a star is because the manual focus could do with a bit of grip on it and the camera base can't turn left or right.
customer_reviews.author: Chaos

customer_reviews.title: Microphone has unbearable high pitched sound
customer_reviews.text: after a couple of video meeting where I had to switch to using the phone because my colleagues could not bear what they described as a "high pitched violin sound" I realized the new webcam was producing it. The sound is ~3234 hertz and likely coming through the power supply but any audio circuit should be designed with proper insulation from that sort of stuff. Very displeased to see such a naive mistake in product sold globally.
customer_reviews.author: Michele A.

customer_reviews.title: Good value, excellent picture quality
customer_reviews.text: First thoughts after just a couple of times using this webcam is that it is excellent value at £49.99, considering what you can pay. The picture quality is really good but not sure about the sound quality as others are saying we sound a bit quiet and muffled. Set-up was really easy, just plug it in and it works. The USB cable needs to be a little longer if your PC sits under your desk. It just about reaches but is a little tight. I bought a 1 metre extension cable for £2.50 which made it less of a stretch. Overall, would recommend at this price.
customer_reviews.author: JandBC

customer_reviews.title: Solid build, good quality, very simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: A nice solid camera. It's nice and neat, fits ok on my slim laptop screen. Easy to set-up, works with everything you'd expect it to. Quality is good too. Very happy with it. Only feedback, it sits a little low on the monitor and it's a bit front heavy, so takes a minute to get it to balance. But once it's in place it's not a problem. I would recommend this webcam.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: A good clear picture
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item after reading most of the reviews. This is an excellent little camera with a very good microphone. It could be argued that the picture quality has some pixilation but this can not be a criticism in a camera of this price. If you are looking for a good webcam at a very reasonable price, look no further - this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: aph

customer_reviews.title: Great Video Quality
customer_reviews.text: Setup and working within 10 seconds on Windows 10 (1909) No Drivers needed. All my application found the camera and worked 1st time. The manual focus is nice, as previous webcams have tried to focus on items behind me, this camera lets me be in control. Bright Red LED shows when it is on and being used. The mount let me securely attach it in the middle of my dual screen setup. The cable is 1.5m long. would have been nice to be a little longer with my PC under the desk. No issue so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mr "F"

customer_reviews.title: Wansview Webcam
customer_reviews.text: Hi, very pleased with this purchase. The picture is far sharper than the built-in camera on my PC. Fast delivery and super easy to set up - literally just plug in via USB port. I have attached a photo from the side in the hope it is helpful to show how it snugly sits on top and attaches to the screen. I already have Wansview cameras so thought a safe choice :-) Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: fortunes soldier

customer_reviews.title: Great VFM webcam with microphone
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera with microphone. I am using it whilst working from home for business use and both the picture and sound quality are excellent. I have done several calls, including ones involving people several hundred miles away and no distortion or loss of signal. Its so simple (genuinely "plug-n-play"). Thoroughly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Used with a windows 10 desktop set up at home. No problem with set up - just 'plug and play'. The picture quality is absolutely first class and the sound - via the speakers and microphone in the unit - is certainly adequate for remote conferencing. Used successfully with Zoom, Teams and Google meet.
customer_reviews.author: Franky

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: With the need to Zoom/Meet over lockdown I was looking for a reasonably priced web cam for my PC rather than rely on the slightly ropey on on my laptop. Works very well at low light levels and the manual focus is a better option than an autofocus in my opinion. Take note those that have complained about a blurry picture!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great for Zoom and Teams Meetings
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of people, I am now working from home which involves taking numerous conference calls each day. I picked up this camera to assist with those calls and it is far better than I was expecting. The image quality is clear and, even though I don't use it, the microphone is more than adequate for online meetings.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Eastlake

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: In general I'm very pleased with this unit. The attachment to the screen didn't fit my monitor but that's just one of things. Was easy enough to fix this with some double sided tape and I'm perfectly happy with this. Any unit like this will never fit every screen arrangement. Very glad I chose this webcam though.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Overaa

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not great
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not 1080p, probably not even HD. Camera is only 2MP (no mention of that in description). Microphone is rubbish (lots of white noise). Image is oversaturated and grany. The manual focus only changes the image from bad to terrible. The mount is flimsy (camera just rests on top of the monitor and is not secured in any way). I'm returning this product. Please don't buy this
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

product_meta.title: wansview Webcam with Microphone, 1080P HD PC Webcam with USB Plug and Play Web Camera for Video Calling, Online study, Conference, Recording, Gaming with Adjustable Base
product_meta.description:
Specifications
Type: Webcam
Material: ABS
DSP Chip: Driverless
Image Sensor: CMOS
Lens: Superior Quality Glass Lens
Dynamic Resolution: 1920*1080P
View Angle : 90°
Frame Rate: 30fps 
Interface: USB 2.0
Working Temperature: -10℃ to 40℃
Working Humidity: 10%-90%
Length: 3.74 inch
Width: 3.34 inch
Height: 2.16 inch


Features
Plug & Play, with Mic, Video Recording
High quality with exquisite appearance.
High definition with 1080P and true color images.
Ajustable bracket and stationary clip
Optical lens, high precision and no distorted pictures.
Wide comaptibility for laptop, computer, desktop and more devices.
Compatible with USB 2.0.
Auto white balance, auto color correction.
Support for Windows/ Mac OS/ Smart TV.
Wide using scenes for online classes, conference, gaming, live streaming, etc.
feature_bullets: ★【1080P USB Webcam with Clear Image】PC webcam is equipped with a Full HD true 1080P resolution lens. Utilizing the advanced H.264 compression technology, this web camera gives a crystal clear image at 30 frames per second, which can offer you a fantastic video time and the best look of you all the time with the 90° wide view angle.

★【Plug and Play & Rotatable Base】Very easy to set up, this USB computer webcam can just plug and play video within 5 minutes, without installing any extra software or drivers. It's compatible with USB 2.0. With the help of 180° rotatable clip and the 75° rotatable lens, it allows you to mount it on any device like laptop, tripod, desktop, computers, LCD screen and even just put it on a desk.

★【With Clear Stereo Microphone & Auto Light Correction】The stereo microphone can capture audio within 20 feet easily, built-in noise cancellation features allowing a crystal clear audio communication. Add the feature of auto light correction. Even it's in the low light condition, the computer webcam can automatically adjust the white balance and offer you a clear bright image in time.

★【Multiple Software Compatibility & Various Applicable Scenarios】Knowing that there are multiple video chatting software for different intentions, we designed this webcam for ultra-wide software compatibility, which allows the webcam to work with many popular video software like Skype, Zoom, Facetime, Facebook, YouTube, PotPlayer and more. You can easily use this web camera for online studying, live streaming, conference, gaming, video calling, and recording.

★【Multiple Operating Systems & Customer Service】Support multiple operating systems, including Windows, Mac OS, Android Smart TV, etc. Since purchasing, we offer friendly lifetime tech support,60 days money-refund and 90 days free replacement. Any issues with the product, welcome to contact us anytime.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars661 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
